comment: Dr. Chan was new to teaching this class, but he did a great job. He explains everything super clearly, makes the class fun and engaging, and answers all questions. Attendance isn't required, but showing up regularly makes it hard to fail. His exam reviews are also very similar to the actual tests.

Dr. Chan makes Number Theory engaging and fun, even though the class isn't easy. With 11 weekly homework assignments (lowest two dropped), three exams (lowest dropped), and a final, the grading is fair. Stay on top of the work, actively learn the material, and you'll do just fine. Highly recommend!

Dr Chan made discrete math enjoyable. I won't say the course was easy but he was really passionate and went through all of the concepts. Attendance is not mandatory but it is crucial to passing the class. If you do your best to complete the quizzes and the homework, and frequently visit his office hours for help you will pass his class!

Great professor for discrete math, often relates topics to real world comp sci examples. Explains things clearly and makes concepts easy to understand. Weekly take home quizzes which are harder than actual exams, if you seek help and regularly review for this class, it's easy. Drops lowest exam and has online vids to help you for each topic!
Whoever gave him a four star instead of five should have their review deleted.

I loved having Dr. Chan as my professor for ODE! He cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. His lectures are engaging, and he is pretty funny! I have had a tough time with math, and my past professors have put a sour taste in my mouth, but I genuinely like math now because of him. He is the best professor I have ever had!

Dr. Chan is a great professor who makes Complex Analysis engaging. The class has 3 tests (1 dropped), about 11 homework assignments (2 dropped), and a final presentation instead of an exam. Challenging but manageable course!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Chan is an excellent professor who makes Differential Equations easy to understand. His humor and passion for math keep the class fun and engaging. Just doing the quizzes and reviewing before tests was enough to succeed. Weekly quizzes (drops 2), 3 exams (drops 1), and online homework (drops 3). Highly recommend!

Dr. Chan is a fantastic professor who knows Diff Eqs like the back of his hand. Hilarious comments & energy because he just loves math that much - it makes a really difficult class a lot more bearable. Study a lot and work hard, take home quiz most weeks (drops 2), 3 exams (drops 1), online HW (drops 3). Tough class, great professor.

He is a great professor for this class. He posts video lectures to watch before class, but still goes over everything before really jumping into problems. He provides a lot of practice problems, and he doesn't stray too far from the hw/in-class problems on the tests. Quizzes are take home, but pretty difficult. He is also super energetic and nice

Professor Chan is a wonderful professor for ODE. He has a fun personality and explains things in many different ways. He also gives a lot of real world examples that relate to what you may be doing in other classes. He posts lecture videos that he expects you to watch before coming to class then in class you do practice problems.

Chan's teaching is very understandable and everything we discuss in class (including the worksheets and quizzes) are always on the test. He is very diligent to help you understand whether in or outside the classroom. His grading policies are also merciful and his dropping of low test, quizzes, and homeworks really help ease of stress.

Make sure you watch the videos he posts before each lecture. They help out a lot in the long run and you will be ahead of everyone else. He is very good at explaining things and relating them to stuff you have done in the past and I would definitely recommend him over any other professor for this class.

He is amazing. I would recommend everyone take him if possible. He makes everything very fair, and he does a very good job with his lectures. He cares and is very willing to help. I cannot recommend him enough.

Honestly if you can take this guy's class, do it. As far as difficulty goes ordinary differential equations isnt the easiest subject It calls upon a lot of past knowledge while expecting you to learn new things. That being said be doesn't make it harder than it has to be. He drops a lot of stuff and grades like fairly. Overall great prof.

Professor Chan is the BEST math professor I have taken. DiffEQ is a tough class but Prof. Chan is very good at teaching it. He goes pretty slow and really makes sure the material is understood. You do need to put the work in tho. Drops lowest 5/25 hws, 3 /11 quizzes and 1/3 tests. Gives take-home quiz every week. If he is open, TAKE HIM.

Dr. Chan is one of the best math professors I've ever had. He made DiffEq fun to learn and honestly a breeze. One quiz a week, 3 tests, and a project final. Reasonable amount of HW. Drops lowest out of each category. He really truly cares and will do a lot to help if you ask. Definitely take him.
